official-title.#text: To establish a smart card pilot program under the Medicare program.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Medicare Common Access Card Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct a pilot program under
for the purpose of utilizing smart card technology for Medicare beneficiary and provider identification cards in order to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title XVIII of the Social Security Act

text.#text: Not later than 18 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
increase the quality of care furnished to Medicare beneficiaries;
improve the accuracy and efficiency in the billing for Medicare items and services furnished by Medicare providers;
reduce the potential for identity theft and other unlawful use of Medicare beneficiary and provider identifying information;
reduce waste, fraud, and abuse in the Medicare program; and
evaluate the efficiencies of patient matching.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct the pilot program in at least 5 geographic areas in which the
determines there is a high risk for waste, fraud, or abuse.

text.#text: The
In designing the pilot program, the

Implementation of a system that utilizes a smart card as a Medicare identification card for Medicare beneficiaries and Medicare providers. Such a card shall contain appropriate security features and protect personal privacy.

Issuance of a new smart card to all Medicare beneficiaries participating in the pilot program. Such card shall not have the Social Security number printed on the front but, instead shall have such number stored securely on the smart card chip along with other information the

Issuance of a new provider card to all Medicare providers participating in the pilot program. Such card shall include a photograph of the provider and shall not have the Medicare provider number printed on the front of the card but, instead shall have such number stored securely on the smart card chip along with other information the
A process for enrollment of all Medicare providers that includes—
identity and certification verification; and
utilization of biometric data, such as fingerprints, for provider identification and authentication.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Common Access Card Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:3/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: are used by both Medicare beneficiaries and Medicare providers to verify eligibility, prevent fraud, and authorize transactions.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Common Access Card Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:3/sp:C

text.#text: A process under which the cards issued under
Distribution of necessary equipment, including cards, card readers, kiosks, biometric readers, and other materials or documents to Medicare beneficiaries and providers at no cost to them.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of Medicare providers’ Medicare billings and Medicare beneficiaries’ Medicare records in order to identify and address inaccurate charges and instances of waste, fraud, or abuse.

text.#text: Regular monitoring and review by the
Reporting mechanisms for measuring the cost savings to the Medicare program by reason of the pilot program.
Including provisions—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996

text.#text: to ensure that all devices and systems utilized as part of the pilot program comply with standards for identity credentials and biometric data developed by the American National Standards Institute and the National Institute of Standards and Technology and Federal requirements relating to interoperability and information security, including all requirements under the

to ensure that a Medicare beneficiary’s and provider’s personal identifying, health, and other information is protected from unauthorized access or disclosure through the use of at least two-factor authentication;

for the development of procedures and guidelines for the use of identification cards, card readers, kiosks, biometric data and readers, and other equipment to verify a Medicare beneficiary’s identity and eligibility for services;
to ensure that each Medicare beneficiary and provider participating in the pilot program is informed of—
the purpose of the program;
the processes for capturing, enrolling, and verifying their eligibility and, with respect to providers, their biometric data;
the manner in which the biometric data for providers will be used; and
the steps that will be taken to protect personal identifying, health, and other information from unauthorized access and disclosure;
for addressing problems related to the loss, theft, or malfunction of or damage to equipment and any identifying documents or materials provided by the
for development of a hotline, Web site, or other means by which Medicare beneficiaries and providers can contact the
for addressing problems related to accessing care outside the pilot area and cases where the individual faces issues related to physical or other capacity limitations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 264(c) of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996/s:264/ss:c

text.#text: Information on the smart card shall only be disclosed if the disclosure of such information is permitted under the Federal regulations (concerning the privacy of individually identifiable health information) promulgated under
Information on the smart card shall be exempt from disclosure under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Common Access Card Act of 2013/s:2/ss:d/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, through rulemaking, expand the duration and the scope of the pilot program, to the extent determined appropriate by the

text.#text: Taking into account the interim report under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: XVIII of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines to be appropriate for the conduct of the pilot program.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report that contains a description of the design and development of the pilot program, including the

text.#text: Not later than 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct an evaluation of the pilot program and submit an interim report to
. Such an evaluation shall include an initial analysis of the deployment of the program, the usability of the card system, and the measures taken to protect beneficiary and provider information.

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date that the pilot program is first implemented, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the pilot program. Such report shall contain a detailed description of issues related to the expansion of the program under
and recommendations for such legislation and administrative actions as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Common Access Card Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: considers appropriate for implementation of the program on a nationwide basis.

text.#text: Not later than 2 years after the date that the pilot program is first implemented, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There are appropriated, from amounts in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#tail: . Amounts appropriated under the preceding sentence shall remain available until expended.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#text: for the design, implementation, and evaluation of the pilot program

text.#text: In this section:

term.#tail: means a provider of services (as defined in

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1861 of the Social Security Act

term.#tail: means the pilot program conducted under this section.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means a secure, electronic, machine readable, fraud-resistant, tamper-resistant card that includes an embedded integrated circuit chip with a secure micro-controller.
